intro: Leptoderris trifoliolata, commonly known as the three-leafed climbing fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
